Settlement deed for property worth Rs.1,60,000/-
27th January 2026
Signed by:- Nallabotula Sunkanna (Aadhaar No.XXXX XXXX XXXX) aged 49
Father Pedda Sunkamma, Nillaur village, Pamidi mandal, Anantapur district,
Signed by:- Nallabotula Lakshmidevi (Aadhaar No.XXXX XXXX XXXX) aged 46 years, husband Sunkanna, Niluru village, Pamidi mandal, Anantapur district, I hereby give you a written settlement document stating that you will be my husband. Out of my love and affection for you, with the intention of creating some immovable property in your name, I have given you the property as per the schedule to which I am entitled as a gift without any consideration and have made the said property your possession this very day. Therefore, from now on, you and your heirs shall enjoy the said property as per the schedule with full rights. Neither I nor my other heirs shall have any rights or obligations. My resignation letter is attached with the settlement document attached with the following schedule:- Anantapuram R.D. Pamidi Sub-D. Pamidi Mandal Neeluru Village The property in the field acquired by my elders and inherited by me is my right and I have the right to it. Information
AADHAAR
Aadhaar is proof of identity. Not of citizenship or date of birth. Date of birth
is the proof of birth document submitted by the Aadhaar number holder as per the rules.
This Aadhaar letter is authenticated by the authentication agency appointed by UIDAI Verify through online authentication or by scanning the QR code using mAadhaar or Aadhaar QR Scanner app available in app stores or by using the secure QR code reader app available at www.uidai.gov.in.
Aadhaar is unique and secure.
Aadhaar needs to be updated with identity and address documents every 10 years from the date of Aadhaar enrolment.
Aadhaar helps you in availing various government and non-government benefits/services.
Update your mobile number and email ID in Aadhaar.
Download the mAadhaar app to avail Aadhaar services.
Use the Lock/Unlock Aadhaar/Biometrics feature to ensure security when Aadhaar/Biometrics is not being used.
Entities requesting Aadhaar must obtain consent
Aadhaar is proof of identity, not of citizenship or date of birth (DOB). DOB
is based on information supported by proof of DOB document specified in
regulations, submitted by Aadhaar number holder.
This Aadhaar letter should be verified through either online
authentication by UIDAI-appointed authentication agency or QR code
scanning using mAadhaar or Aadhaar QR Scanner app available in
app stores or using secure QR code reader app available on
www.uidai.gov.in.
Aadhaar is unique and secure.
Documents to support identity and address should be updated in
Aadhaar after every 10 years from the date of enrollment for Aadhaar.
Aadhaar helps you avail of various Government and Non-
Government benefits/services.
Keep your mobile number and email id updated in Aadhaar.
Download mAadhaar app to avail of Aadhaar services.
Use the feature of Lock/Unlock Aadhaar/biometrics to ensure
security when not using Aadhaar/biometrics.
Entities seeking Aadhaar are obliged to seek consent.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 259 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Nallabothula Laxmidevi in favour of her Husband, Nallabothula Sunkanna towards the property admeasuring an extent of 120 Sq.Yds., bearing Door number 1-166, assessment no. 166, comprised in survey number 111-A, situated in Neelur Village, Gram Panchayath and Pamidi Mandal, within the District of Anantapur, registered at sub-registrar office Pamidi(1213), is bounded as follows: North by: Rastha South by: Site of Chinna Bojjanna East by: Donor's Open Site West by: Road
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
